title: Beat Bloating with Ayurvedic Digestive Tonics
author: Harish
excerpt: Ajwain, cumin, and hing have been used for centuries to relieve gas and stimulate digestion. Learn recipes, uses, and safety tips.
content:
Why Traditional Carminatives Work

Ajwain and cumin are warming, aromatic seeds that stimulate digestive enzymes and soothe bloating. Hing (asafoetida) acts as a potent antispasmodic and carminative—especially helpful for flatulence and trapped gas.

How to Use the Syrup

  • Take 1–2 tsp after heavy or rich meals.
  • Use sparingly as needed; not intended for chronic use without practitioner guidance.

Simple Home Practices to Reduce Bloating

  • Chew slowly and avoid cold drinks with meals.
  • Use warm fennel or cumin water after meals.
  • Stay lightly active after eating (short walk).

When to See a Doctor

Persistent, severe, or recurrent abdominal pain, unexplained weight loss, or bleeding requires medical evaluation. Digestive tonics support occasional discomfort but are not a replacement for medical care.
